definition: ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: We can try to buy some tickets outside the stadium from a scalper.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以試着在體育場外買黃牛票。

sentences.english: He bought the ticket at a high price from a (ticket) scalper.
sentences.chinese: 他從一個票販子手裏高價買了張黃牛票。

sentences.english: He's planning to go to Germany anyway and try for scalped tickets.
sentences.chinese: 他計劃無論如何也要到德國去，並且努力買到黃牛票。

sentences.english: Fans will find it harder to get scalped tickets at the stadiums this year.
sentences.chinese: 球迷們發現今年的運動會的黃牛票比較難買到。

sentences.english: The move is part of a government effort to crack down on scalpers.
sentences.chinese: 這是政府打擊黃牛票販的一項舉措。

definition: to buy or upgrade a ticket after boarding a train, boat etc/to buy a ticket for a show after having sat down in the theater
to bargain/to cut or beat down a price
(Tw) tourist from mainland China/illegal immigrant from mainland China
excuse me (i.e. let me through, please)
to force sb to buy or sell/to trade using coercion
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
to beat down the price/to haggle/to slash one's prices
